Topic: [topic] Question: [question] Choices: [choices] Answer: [answer]
Topic: science Question: Which statement best explains why photosynthesis is the foundation of most food webs? Choices: I. Sunlight is the source of energy for nearly all ecosystems.
II. Most ecosystems are found on land instead of in water.
III. The producers in all ecosystems are plants.
IV. Carbon dioxide is more available than other gases. Answer:
test.GroundTruth: I. Sunlight is the source of energy for nearly all ecosystems.

Topic: science Question: Antarctica is a continent at Earth's south pole. Fossils of tropical fern plants were discovered in Antarctica even though these plants do not grow there today. Which conclusion does the fossil evidence best support? Choices: I. Millions of years ago, Earth's south pole was much colder than it is today.
II. Millions of years ago, Antarctica was in a warmer location on Earth.
III. Recently, birds stopped carrying the seeds of fern plants to Antarctica.
IV. Recently, a natural disaster killed all of the fern plants in Antarctica. Answer:
test.GroundTruth: II. Millions of years ago, Antarctica was in a warmer location on Earth.

Topic: science Question: A group of fish was released into a local lake. This species of fish had never lived in the lake before. Scientists want to collect data on how the lake's ecosystem is affected by the new fish. Which method of data collection will give the most accurate results? Choices: I. Observing the surface of the lake for signs of the new fish after one week
II. Sampling fish populations in the lake over several years
III. Measuring oxygen levels in the lake for two months

test.GroundTruth: II. Sampling fish populations in the lake over several years

Topic: [topic] Question: [question] Choices: [choices] Answer: [answer]
Topic: science Question: A scientist finds a metamorphic rock formation next to a magma chamber and determines that it was originally a sedimentary rock formation. He concludes that the temperature of the magma chamber caused the rock formation to become metamorphic. Which is another reliable explanation of how the rock formation was changed? Choices: I. weight of heavy machinery moving over the rocks
II. pressure on the rock formation inside Earth
III. a sandstorm that caused the rocks to be eroded
IV. a quick burial of the rocks by tons of volcanic ash Answer:
test.GroundTruth: II. pressure on the rock formation inside Earth
